location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 13: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Government circular commands from 14 July 1821, which stated that in future no public table is ever to be kept up at the Residency by the Assistant in the absence of the Resident. Dow states that the order shall be duly obeyed.
